name: fatally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that causes death: Several people were injured, two fatally. He was convicted of fatally stabbing a police officer.
in a way that seriously damages or harms something or someone, or may cause them to fail in the future: The banking system is fatally flawed. Perhaps we are fatally drawn to the dangerous and mysterious. See
fatal
More examplesFewer examples"One man was shot but not fatally," she said.She was fatally injured when crossing a road.He ate onions, to which he was fatally allergic.Her authority had been fatally weakened.The incident fatally damaged his self-belief.
